text_description: Numbers of viral proteins: 100 S proteins, 20 E pentamers (100 proteins), 1000 M dimers (2000 proteins), 1000 N proteins
ref: Yinon M Bar-On, Avi Flamholz, Rob Phillips, Ron Milo. Science Forum: SARS-CoV-2 (COVID-19) by the numbers. eLife 2020;9:e57309 DOI: 10.7554/eLife.57309

text_description: Full-length glycosylated S protein model was downloaded from CHARMM-GUI. This model was modified from PDB 6VSB. The animation shows a 'breathing' motion where different subunits are in the 'up' state at different times. The relative length of time that the subunits should spend in the up state was uncertain.
M protein dimer and E protein pentamers were downloaded from Feig lab repository

Full-length N protein model was downloaded from Zhang lab repository and arranged in octamers as described in Chen et al 2007. N and C terminus were rotated and moved relative to one another in the animation to avoid steric clashes. This assumes a flexible attachment between N and C lobes. Significant uncertainty about the structure of RNP; not clear how flexible RNP should be, whether it should be branched, etc.
ref: Chun-Yuan Chen, Chung-ke Chang, Yi-Wei Chang, Shih-Che Sue, Hsin-I Bai, Lilianty Riang, Chwan-Deng Hsiao, and Tai-huang Huang. Structure of the SARS Coronavirus Nucleocapsid Protein RNA-binding Dimerization Domain Suggests a Mechanism for Helical Packaging of Viral RNA. J Mol Biol. 2007 May 11; 368(4): 1075–1086.

text_description: 30kb RNA should be around 9000 nm long. There is less than that in this animation; I wasn't sure how much RNA might not be tightly bound by N protein.
Cell surface proteins: ACE2 (purple), TMPRSS2 (orange), furin (yellow)
ACE2 is created using PDB 6M17 and animated as having a flexible 'neck' to allow for tilted angle when binding to S protein.
TMPRSS2 was created using a model from the PhyreRisk repository. A 13nm flexible linker was added and linked to a transmembrane domain.
Furin model was created using PDB 1P8J (catalytic and protease domain), with a 42nm linker to a transmembrane domain added

ACE2 on the cell membrane capture S proteins when they are in the "up" state. In the animation, an ACE dimer is shown binding to a S protein. Whether all three S proteins need to be bound for infection to occur is not clear. The number of Spikes that are engaged by ACE2 is also uncertain.

S proteins are cleaved by furin at the S1/S2 site, and by TMPRSS2 at the S2' site. In the animation, cleavages are indicated by flashes of light. Each S protein is shown undergoing both cleavage events.
ref: Dorothea Bestle, Miriam Ruth Heindl, Hannah Limburg, Thuy Van Lam van, Oliver Pilgram, Hong Moulton, David A. Stein, Kornelia Hardes, Markus Eickmann, Olga Dolnik, Cornelius Rohde, Stephan Becker, Hans-Dieter Klenk, Wolfgang Garten, Torsten Steinmetzer, Eva Böttcher-Friebertshäuser. TMPRSS2 and furin are both essential for proteolytic activation and spread of SARS-CoV-2 in human airway epithelial cells and provide promising drug targets. BioRxiv. https://doi.org/10.1101/2020.04.15.042085

text_description: S proteins transition to the pre-hairpin intermediate, with fusion peptide embedded in the host cell membrane.
S protein prefusion structure is from PDB 6VSB (residues 816-1273). S protein pre-hairpin intermediate model was created by Jason McClellan. The animated transition is speculative.
S proteins transition to the post-fusion state.
S protein postfusion structure is PDB 6M3W with missing residues modeled in using the pre-hairpin intermediate structure as a guide. The animated transition is speculative.
Membrane fusion between the host cell membrane and the viral membrane occurs
